screening_include_high_conf.rationale: Study matches all PICO elements with high confidence.

screening_exclude_high_conf.rationale: Population, intervention, and study design do not match criteria.

screening_include_low_conf.rationale: Possible match but several elements unclear in abstract.

extraction_sample.intervention_description: Antimicrobial stewardship program with daily review

criteria_generation_pico.research_question: Effect of antimicrobial stewardship on ICU outcomes

criteria_generation_pico_alt.research_question: Effect of antimicrobial stewardship on ICU outcomes

evidence.outcomes_reported: Primary outcome was 30-day mortality; secondary outcomes included length of stay and antibiotic consumption
evidence.intervention_type: daily audit and feedback of antimicrobial prescriptions

rob2_d1_randomization.rationale: Adequate random sequence generation using computer-generated random numbers. Allocation concealment maintained through sealed opaque envelopes.
supporting_quotes: Participants were randomly assigned using a computer-generated sequence

rob2_d2_deviations.rationale: Double-blind design with identical placebo. No protocol deviations reported.
supporting_quotes: Neither participants nor investigators were aware of group assignment

rob2_d3_missing_data.rationale: Less than 5% missing data. Intention-to-treat analysis performed with multiple imputation for missing values.
supporting_quotes: Follow-up was complete for 96% of participants

rob2_d4_measurement.rationale: Primary outcome (30-day mortality) is objective and ascertained from hospital records. Outcome assessors were blinded.
supporting_quotes: Mortality data were extracted from electronic health records by blinded assessors

rob2_d5_reporting.rationale: Study protocol was pre-registered. All pre-specified outcomes were reported. Statistical analysis plan was published before unblinding.
supporting_quotes: The trial was registered at ClinicalTrials.gov (NCT01234567) before enrollment

rob2_d1_randomization.rationale: Computer-generated randomization with adequate allocation concealment.
supporting_quotes: Randomization was performed using a central web-based system

rob2_d2_deviations.rationale: Open-label design. Some participants in the control group received the intervention outside the study protocol.
supporting_quotes: Due to the nature of the intervention, blinding was not possible
12 control participants received stewardship consultation

rob2_d3_missing_data.rationale: Complete follow-up for 94% of participants. Sensitivity analysis showed results were robust to missing data assumptions.
supporting_quotes: Sensitivity analyses using worst-case scenarios confirmed the primary findings

rob2_d4_measurement.rationale: Outcome assessment was not blinded. Subjective secondary outcomes (clinical improvement) may have been influenced by knowledge of group assignment.
supporting_quotes: Clinical improvement was assessed by treating physicians who were aware of the treatment allocation

rob2_d5_reporting.rationale: Pre-registered protocol with all outcomes reported as specified.
supporting_quotes: All outcomes listed in the protocol were reported in the manuscript

robins_d1_confounding.rationale: Key confounders (age, severity, comorbidities) were controlled through multivariable regression, but residual confounding from unmeasured variables (e.g., physician experience) cannot be excluded.
supporting_quotes: Multivariable logistic regression adjusted for age, APACHE II score, and Charlson comorbidity index

robins_d2_selection.rationale: All eligible patients during the study period were included. Start of follow-up and start of intervention were well-defined and aligned.
supporting_quotes: All consecutive admissions to the ICU during the study period were screened for eligibility

robins_d3_classification.rationale: Intervention status was determined by the implementation date of the stewardship program and was not affected by participant characteristics.
supporting_quotes: The stewardship program was implemented hospital-wide on January 1, 2023

robins_d4_deviations.rationale: No systematic deviations from intended interventions. Co-interventions were balanced between groups.
supporting_quotes: No significant differences in co-interventions were observed between the pre- and post-implementation periods

robins_d5_missing_data.rationale: Outcome data were available for 88% of participants. Missing data were handled with multiple imputation, but the proportion of missing data was higher in the pre-implementation group.
supporting_quotes: Outcome data were missing for 12% of participants, predominantly in the pre-implementation cohort

robins_d6_measurement.rationale: Primary outcome (30-day mortality) was obtained from hospital electronic records and is not subject to measurement error.
supporting_quotes: Mortality was ascertained from the hospital information system and verified against national death records

robins_d7_reporting.rationale: Study protocol was published before data analysis. All pre-specified outcomes were reported.
supporting_quotes: The study protocol was published in BMJ Open prior to data collection

quadas_d1_patient_selection.rationale: Consecutive patients with suspected infection were enrolled. No inappropriate exclusions. Case-control design was avoided.
supporting_quotes: All consecutive patients presenting with suspected bloodstream infection were prospectively enrolled

quadas_d2_index_test.rationale: The threshold for the index test was pre-specified, but it is unclear whether the test was interpreted without knowledge of the reference standard results.
supporting_quotes: A procalcitonin threshold of 0.5 ng/mL was used as the cut-off for positivity

quadas_d3_reference_standard.rationale: Blood culture (reference standard) was performed for all patients. Results were interpreted by clinical microbiologists blinded to the index test results.
supporting_quotes: Blood cultures were processed in an accredited laboratory by microbiologists blinded to procalcitonin results

quadas_d4_flow_timing.rationale: All patients received both the index test and reference standard within 24 hours. No patients were excluded from the analysis.
supporting_quotes: Blood cultures and procalcitonin measurements were obtained simultaneously at presentation
All enrolled patients were included in the final analysis
